doc.wiki: Trade secrets are a type of intellectual property that comprise formulas, practices, processes, designs, instruments, patterns, or compilations of information that have inherent economic value because they are not generally known or readily ascertainable by others, and which the owner takes reasonable measures to keep secret.[1] In some jurisdictions, such secrets are referred to as confidential information. The precise language by which a trade secret is defined varies by jurisdiction, as do the particular types of information that are subject to trade secret protection.
